definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt

sentences.english: There will be a sale of impounds by the police department next week.
sentences.chinese: 下周有个警方罚没物品的特卖会。

sentences.english: Put a full-page ad in the newspaper every Friday, advertising the weekly special coming up.
sentences.chinese: 每周五在报纸上做整版广告，为每周特卖作宣传。

sentences.english: The department store had a sale on household appliances.
sentences.chinese: 百货公司有家用品特卖活动。

sentences.english: Can you believe it? Sample sale. 50% off.
sentences.chinese: 你能相信吗？样本特卖。打五折。

sentences.english: Does that mean the Sam Goody's sale is over?
sentences.chinese: 那表示山姆古迪商店的大特卖结束了？

sentences.english: Shoppers flocked to the sale at the new mall.
sentences.chinese: 大批顾客涌进新购物商场的特卖会。

sentences.english: The department store sale will run from this Saturday through the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 百货公司的特卖会从这周六延续到这个月底。

definition: to sell strongly/to be in great demand
group buying/collective buying/buying by a group of individuals who negotiate a discount for the group
buy one, get one free/two for the price of one
abbr. for 特別優惠|特别优惠[te4 bie2 you1 hui4]/ex gratia
see 商城縣|商城县[Shang1 cheng2 xian4]
to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)
brick and mortar business/physical (rather than online) retail store
